intro: Roella gracilis, commonly known as the slender roella, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grassy areas and along roadsides, preferring well-drained soils. Its slender stems and small, daisy-like flowers make it a distinctive member of the local flora. It is often used in ornamental gardening due to its delicate appearance and ability to thrive in various conditions.
